standard\_formal: Let T carry polarity labels Θ ∈ {Θ+, Θ−, ...} on indices. A Σ-contraction over an index i is allowed only if the paired indices possess compatible polarity labels under the Θ-algebra.
igsoa\_formal: Given a tensor D with polarity annotation map p: I \-\> ΘChannel and contraction plan P, a ΣΘ-contraction is defined only when (i, j) ∈ P implies p(i) \~Θ p(j), where \~Θ is the Θ-compatibility relation.
